subtitleNullable: processed from Autism Prediction Challenge hosted by REVA
descriptionNullable:
# Abstract
> This dataset is adapted from [the dataset on autism prediction](https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/autismdiagnosis/data) created for the [Autism Prediction Challenge](https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/autismdiagnosis/) hosted by REVA Academy for Corporate Excellence, REVA University. 

# Preprocessing
>The whole preprocessing is described in [this notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/code/joseguzman/8-models-that-predict-autism-spectrum-disorder). Briefly, 
* Ethnicity and relation with values '?' and 'other' are merged to 'other'
* 'AgeGroup' variable is created with children (age< 14), youth (age >=14 & < 24), adult (age >=24 & < 64) and senior (age > 64).
* 'Continent' variable is created to arrange every country to a continent.
* The variables 'country', 'ethnicity', 'relation' and 'age' are weighted by the proportion of positive observations found in the training dataset (PClass/ADS = 1), as suggested in [this notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/code/balabaskar/autism-prediction-eda-with-0-827-score) and this [one](https://www.kaggle.com/code/ezzzio/autism-prediction-0-85805-score/notebook).
* 'age' and 'result' are z-scored
* One-hot-encoder is applied to 'ethnicity', 'relation', 'AgeGroup', 'continent'.

Finally, 'age_desc', 'gender', 'used_app_before', 'contry_of_res' were removed from the original dataset, because they're not statistically related to the target variable (when tested with chi-squares).

# Acknowledgements

>## Citations
1. Tabtah, F. (2017). Autism Spectrum Disorder Screening: Machine Learning Adaptation and DSM-5 Fulfillment. Proceedings of the 1st International Conference on Medical and Health Informatics 2017, pp.1-6. Taichung City, Taiwan, ACM.
2. Thabtah, F. (2017). Machine Learning in Autistic Spectrum Disorder Behavioural Research: A Review. To Appear in Informatics for Health and Social Care Journal. December 2017

Public Domain

Photo by [Peter Burdon](https://unsplash.com/es/@peterburdon?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText) on Unsplash
title: Preprocessed Autism Screening on Adults

# Preprocessing
>The whole preprocessing is described in [this notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/code/joseguzman/8-models-that-predict-autism-spectrum-disorder). Briefly,

* 'AgeGroup' variable is created with children (age< 14), youth (age >=14 & < 24), adult (age >=24 & < 64) and senior (age > 64).
